dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2987 RH: Capping Excessive Awarding of SBLC Entrants Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bresnahan introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on April 24, 2025

form.official-title: To amend the Small Business Act to require a limit on the number of small business lending companies, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Capping Excessive Awarding of SBLC Entrants Act of 2025 or the CEASE Act of 2025.

section.header: Limitation on number of small business lending companies
section.text: Section 23 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 650) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Limitation on number of small business lending companies
subsection.text: The Administrator shall ensure that not more than 16 small business lending companies that are not nonprofit entities are authorized to make loans under section 7 at any time.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
